item.name: Development
Users

request.description:
### Criar um registro de admin

Esse endpoint permite adicionar um registro de `Admin`, contudo, `email` é um campo único e `required`. Você também pode persistir um `ProfileAdmin` através desse endpoint.

---

#### Nested Attributes for Profile Admin (`profile_admin_attributes`)

É possível informar propriedades de `ProfileAdmin`, para isso, você precisará informar um objeto JSON cujo em seu payload contenha uma chave inícial com o nome de `profile_admin_attributes`.  
Os campos disponíveis para edição são os seguintes:

| Propriedade | Tipo | Valor Esperado (se aplicável) |
| --- | --- | --- |
| role | String | um dos: "lawyer", "paralegal", "trainee", "secretary", "counter", "excounter", "representant" |
| status | String | um dos: "active", "inactive", "pending" |
| admin_id | Integer | \- |
| office_id | Integer | \- |
| name | String | \- |
| gender | String | um dos: "female", "male", "other" |
| oab | String | \- |
| rg | String | \- |
| cpf | String | \- |
| nationality | String | um dos: "brazilian", "foreigner" |
| civil_status | String | um dos: "single", "married", "divorced", "widower", "union" |
| birth | date | "YYYY-MM-DD" |

---

### Atualizar um registro de admin

Esse endpoint permite alterar o `email` de um `Admin`. \[IMPORTANTE\] Caso`profile_admin_attributes`seja informado, então, esse será 'adicionado' e o perfil antigo não será mais associado ao Admin
Remove um registro

item.description:
Aqui, você encontrará as requisições cujo o endpoint é `` `/admins` ``. As ações permitidas são as seguintes:

- **index**: lista todos os registros de admins e parte de seus dados_;_
    
- **show**: _retorna informação de um registro;_
    
- **create:** _cria um registro;_
    
- **update:** _atualiza um registro;_
    
- **delete:** _indisponível._

item.name: Profile Users

request.description:
### Criar um registro

Esse endpoint permite adicionar um registro de `ProfileAdmin`. Você também pode gerenciar outras relações através desse endpoint, veja:

- dados de Admin (`admin_attributes`);
- dados de Address (`addresses_attributes`);
- dados de BankAccount (`bank_account_attributes`);
- dados de Phone (`phones_attributes`);
- dados de Email (`emails_attributes`).

| name | String | \- |

| oab | String | \- |
| rg | String | \- |
| cpf | String | \- |
| nationality | String | um dos: "brazilian", "foreigner" |
| civil_status | String | um dos: "single", "married", "divorced", "widower", "union" |
| birth | date | "202X-12-20" |

request.description:
### Criar um registro

Esse endpoint permite adicionar um registro de `Job`. Você precisará de:

- profile_admin_id;
- work_id;
- profile_customer_id;
    

---

#### Dados de Job

Os campos disponíveis para edição são os seguintes:

| Propriedade | Tipo | Valor Esperado (se aplicável) |
| --- | --- | --- |
| description | String | \- |
| deadline | Date | \- |
| status | String | \- |
| priority | String | \- |
| comment | String | \- |
| profile_customer_id | Integer | \- |
| profile_admin_id | Integer | \- |
| work_id | Integer | \- |

---

### Exemplo Criação

``` json
{
  "job": {
    "description": "Uma tarefa de um trabalho",
    "deadline": "2023-12-10",
    "status": "pending",
    "priority": "1",
    "comment": "Precisamos verificar os documentos",
    "profile_customer_id": 1,
    "profile_admin_id": 1,
    "work_id": 1
  }
}

 ```

---

### Atualizar um registro

Esse endpoint permite atualizar um registro de `Job`. Você precisará de:

- profile_admin_id;
- work_id;
- profile_customer_id;
    

---

#### Dados de Job

Os campos disponíveis para edição são os seguintes:

| Propriedade | Tipo | Valor Esperado (se aplicável) |
| --- | --- | --- |
| description | String | \- |
| deadline | Date | \- |
| status | String | \- |
| priority | String | \- |
| comment | String | \- |
| profile_customer_id | Integer | \- |
| profile_admin_id | Integer | \- |
| work_id | Integer | \- |

---

### Exemplo Criação

``` json
{
  "job": {
    "description": "Uma tarefa de um trabalho",
    "deadline": "2023-12-10",
    "status": "pending",
    "priority": "1",
    "comment": "Precisamos verificar os documentos",
    "profile_customer_id": 1,
    "profile_admin_id": 1,
    "work_id": 1
  }
}

 ```

---

### Remover um registro

Esse endpoint permite remover um registro de `Job`

item.name: Works

request.description:
### Retorna todos os Works cadastrados na aplicação.

Retorna a seguinte estrutura:

``` json
{
    "data": [
        {
            "id": "1",
            "type": "work",
            "attributes": {
                "procedure": "administrative",
                "subject": "administrative_subject",
                "number": 123,
                "civel_area": "family",
                "social_security_areas": null,
                "laborite_areas": null,
                "other_description": null,
                "tributary_areas": null,
                "physical_lawyer": null,
                "responsible_lawyer": null,
                "partner_lawyer": null,
                "intern": null,
                "bachelor": null,
                "initial_atendee": null,
                "note": null,
                "folder": null,
                "procurations_created": 0
            }
        }
    ],
    "meta": {
        "total_count": 1
    }
}

 ```

  
### Filtros

Você pode enviar o(s) seguinte(s) query parameters:
- `limit`;
 - Limita o retorno em x records;
 - Ex: `?limit=10`.
- `customer_id`
 - Filtra por profile_customer_ids onde o id é x;
 - Ex: `?customer_id=1`

### Consultar a informação de um objeto

Retorna a seguinte estrutura:

``` json
{
  "data": {
    "id": "1",
    "type": "profile_customer",
    "attributes": {
      "customer_id": 1,
      "customer_type": "physical_person",
      "name": "Maria Fernanda Laranjeira Jr.",
      "last_name": "Gomide",
      "cpf": "99066815327",
      "cnpj": "",
      "emails": [
        {
          "id": 1,
          "email": "estella.spinka@zboncak-cole.example",
          "created_at": "2023-12-04T06:20:21.585-03:00",
          "updated_at": "2023-12-04T06:20:21.585-03:00"
        },
        {
          "id": 2,
          "email": "kenyetta@ondricka.example",
          "created_at": "2023-12-04T06:20:21.613-03:00",
          "updated_at": "2023-12-04T06:20:21.613-03:00"
        }
      ],
 ```

item.name: LegalCostsTypes
item.description:
Esse endpoint é para permitir que o User tenha liberdade para criar suas próprias entradas de LegalCosts (Custas Processuais) uma vez que existe uma gama muito grande desse tipo de despesas que é impossível de prever.

How the LegalCostType Key Works:

1. System Types (Pre-defined)
    

- System types have pre-defined keys like custas_judiciais, taxa_judiciaria, etc.
    
- These are created via seeds with is_system: true and team_id: nil
    
- System types are shared across all teams
    
- Their keys cannot be edited by users
    

1. Custom Types (Team-specific)
    

- Teams can create their own custom cost types
    
- When creating a custom type, the user must provide a key
    
- The key must be unique within that team's scope
    
- This means Team A can have custom_fee and Team B can also have custom_fee without conflict
    

1. Frontend Implementation
    
    Based on the controller params, the frontend should:
    
    // When creating a new custom legal cost type  
    POST /api/v1/legal_cost_types  
    {  
    "legal_cost_type": {  
    "key": "taxa_especial", // User needs to provide this  
    "name": "Taxa Especial do Cliente",  
    "description": "Taxa específica para este cliente",  
    "category": "other",  
    "display_order": 500,  
    "active": true  
    }  
    }
    
2. Key Generation Strategy (Recommended for Frontend)
    
    The frontend could implement a key generation helper:
    
    // Convert name to a valid key  
    function generateKey(name) {  
    return name  
    .toLowerCase()  
    .normalize('NFD')  
    .replace(/\[\\u0300-\\u036f\]/g, '') // Remove accents  
    .replace(/\[^a-z0-9\]+/g, '_') // Replace non-alphanumeric with underscore__.replace(/^_|_$/g, ''); // Remove leading/trailing underscores  
    }
    
    // Example:  
    // "Taxa Especial do Cliente" -> "taxa_especial_do_cliente"  
    // "Honorários Periciais 2024" -> "honorarios_periciais_2024"
    
3. UI/UX Recommendations
    
    For the best user experience, the frontend should:
    
4. Auto-generate the key from the name field as the user types
    
5. Allow manual editing of the auto-generated key if needed
    
6. Validate uniqueness before submission (optional API endpoint could be added)
    
7. Show existing keys to avoid duplicates
    
8. Indicate system vs custom types clearly in the UI
    
9. When Selecting Cost Types
    
    When creating a LegalCostEntry, users select from:
    

- System types (available to all teams)
    
- Their team's custom types
    
    The selection would typically be a dropdown showing the name field, but storing the legal_cost_type_id in the  
    database.
    
    Would you like me to create an endpoint to validate key uniqueness or add a key generation helper to the API?

item.name: LegalCostsEntry
item.description:
# Legal Costs API Documentation

## Overview

The Legal Costs system allows managing legal expenses associated with honoraries in the system. Each honorary can have one legal cost record with multiple cost entries.

## Models Structure

### LegalCost

- Belongs to Honorary (one-to-one)
    
- Has many LegalCostEntries
    
- Tracks who is responsible for costs and admin fees
    

### LegalCostEntry

- Belongs to LegalCost
    
- Belongs to LegalCostType
    
- Tracks individual cost items with amounts, due dates, and payment status
    

### LegalCostType

- System-wide or team-specific cost type definitions
    
- Used to categorize and standardize cost entries
    

## API Endpoints

### 1\. Create Legal Cost

```
POST /api/v1/works/:work_id/honoraries/:honorary_id/legal_cost

 ```

Request body:

``` json
{
  "legal_cost": {
    "client_responsible": true,
    "include_in_invoices": true,
    "admin_fee_percentage": 10.0
  }
}

 ```

### 2\. Get Legal Cost

```
GET /api/v1/works/:work_id/honoraries/:honorary_id/legal_cost

 ```

### 3\. Update Legal Cost

```
PUT /api/v1/works/:work_id/honoraries/:honorary_id/legal_cost

 ```

### 4\. Delete Legal Cost

```
DELETE /api/v1/works/:work_id/honoraries/:honorary_id/legal_cost

 ```

### 5\. Create Legal Cost Entry

```
POST /api/v1/works/:work_id/honoraries/:honorary_id/legal_cost/entries

 ```

Request body:

``` json
{
  "legal_cost_entry": {
    "legal_cost_type_id": 1,
    "name": "Custas iniciais do processo",
    "amount": 850.00,
    "estimated": false,
    "due_date": "2025-09-30",
    "description": "Pagamento das custas iniciais para protocolo"
  }
}

 ```

### 6\. List Legal Cost Entries

```
GET /api/v1/works/:work_id/honoraries/:honorary_id/legal_cost/entries

 ```

Query parameters:

- `cost_type`: Filter by cost type
    
- `paid`: Filter by payment status (true/false)
    
- `estimated`: Filter by estimation status (true/false)
    
- `overdue`: Show only overdue entries (true)
    
- `upcoming`: Show only upcoming entries (true)
    

### 7\. Update Legal Cost Entry

```
PUT /api/v1/works/:work_id/honoraries/:honorary_id/legal_cost/entries/:id

 ```

### 8\. Delete Legal Cost Entry

```
DELETE /api/v1/works/:work_id/honoraries/:honorary_id/legal_cost/entries/:id

 ```

### 9\. Mark Entry as Paid

```
POST /api/v1/works/:work_id/honoraries/:honorary_id/legal_cost/entries/:id/mark_as_paid

 ```

Request body (optional):

``` json
{
  "payment_date": "2025-08-31",
  "receipt_number": "REC-001",
  "payment_method": "credit_card"
}

 ```

### 10\. Mark Entry as Unpaid

```
POST /api/v1/works/:work_id/honoraries/:honorary_id/legal_cost/entries/:id/mark_as_unpaid

 ```

### 11\. Batch Create Entries

```
POST /api/v1/works/:work_id/honoraries/:honorary_id/legal_cost/entries/batch_create

 ```

Request body:

``` json
{
  "entries": [
    {
      "legal_cost_type_id": 1,
      "name": "Entry 1",
      "amount": 100.00
    },
    {
      "legal_cost_type_id": 2,
      "name": "Entry 2", 
      "amount": 200.00
    }
  ]
}

 ```

### 12\. Get Entries by Type

```
GET /api/v1/works/:work_id/honoraries/:honorary_id/legal_cost/entries/by_type

 ```

### 13\. Legal Cost Summary

```
GET /api/v1/works/:work_id/honoraries/:honorary_id/legal_cost/summary

 ```

### 14\. Overdue Entries

```
GET /api/v1/works/:work_id/honoraries/:honorary_id/legal_cost/overdue_entries

 ```

### 15\. Upcoming Entries

```
GET /api/v1/works/:work_id/honoraries/:honorary_id/legal_cost/upcoming_entries

 ```

Query parameters:

- `days`: Number of days ahead to look (default: 30)
    

## Authentication

All endpoints require JWT authentication token in the Authorization header:

```
Authorization: Bearer <jwt_token>

 ```

## Response Format

All responses use JSON:API format with data, relationships, and meta information.

## Status Codes

- 200: Success (GET, PUT)
    
- 201: Created (POST)
    
- 204: No Content (DELETE)
    
- 401: Unauthorized
    
- 404: Not Found
    
- 422: Unprocessable Entity (validation errors)
    
- 500: Internal Server Error
    

## Example Usage

### Complete Flow

1. Create a legal cost for an honorary
    
2. Add multiple cost entries
    
3. Track payment status
    
4. Generate summaries and reports
    

### Testing with cURL

``` bash
# Login
TOKEN=$(curl -X POST http://localhost:3000/api/v1/login \
  -H "Content-Type: application/json" \
  -d '{"auth": {"email": "u1@gmail.com", "password": "123456"}}' \
  | jq -r '.data.token')
# Create legal cost
curl -X POST http://localhost:3000/api/v1/works/35/honoraries/10/legal_cost \
  -H "Authorization: Bearer $TOKEN" \
  -H "Content-Type: application/json" \
  -d '{
    "legal_cost": {
      "client_responsible": true,
      "include_in_invoices": true,
      "admin_fee_percentage": 10.0
    }
  }'
# Add entry
curl -X POST http://localhost:3000/api/v1/works/35/honoraries/10/legal_cost/entries \
  -H "Authorization: Bearer $TOKEN" \
  -H "Content-Type: application/json" \
  -d '{
    "legal_cost_entry": {
      "legal_cost_type_id": 1,
      "name": "Court fees",
      "amount": 850.00,
      "due_date": "2025-09-30"
    }
  }'

 ```

### Atualizar um registro

Esse endpoint permite adicionar um registro de `ProfileCustomer`. Você também pode gerenciar outras relações através desse endpoint, veja:

- dados de Address (`addresses_attributes`);
    
- dados de BankAccount (`bank_account_attributes`);
    
- dados de Customer (`customer_attributes`);
    
- dados de Phone (`phones_attributes`);
    
- dados de Represent _(_`represent_attributes`);
    
- dados de Email (`emails_attributes`).
    

---

#### Dados de Profile Customer

Os campos disponíveis para edição são os seguintes:

| customer_id | Integer | \- |

request.description:
### Criar um registro de admin

Esse endpoint permite adicionar um registro de `Admin`, contudo, `email` é um campo único e `required`. Você também pode persistir um `ProfileAdmin` através desse endpoint.

---

#### Nested Attributes for Profile Admin (`profile_admin_attributes`)

É possível informar propriedades de `ProfileAdmin`, para isso, você precisará informar um objeto JSON cujo em seu payload contenha uma chave inícial com o nome de `profile_admin_attributes`.  
Os campos disponíveis para edição são os seguintes:

| Propriedade | Tipo | Valor Esperado (se aplicável) |
| --- | --- | --- |
| role | String | um dos: "lawyer", "paralegal", "trainee", "secretary", "counter", "excounter", "representant" |
| status | String | um dos: "active", "inactive", "pending" |
| admin_id | Integer | \- |
| office_id | Integer | \- |
| name | String | \- |
| gender | String | um dos: "female", "male", "other" |
| oab | String | \- |
| rg | String | \- |
| cpf | String | \- |
| nationality | String | um dos: "brazilian", "foreigner" |
| civil_status | String | um dos: "single", "married", "divorced", "widower", "union" |
| birth | date | "YYYY-MM-DD" |

---
